dublin_core.dcvalue: Use of a cell phone reduces attention and increases response times 62 people 30 men 32 women were confronted with a confederate wearing a large leg brace who dropped a stack of magazines and feigned difficulty retrieving them Among the 33 people who talked on their cell phones only 9 offered their help whereas among the 29 people who did not talk on their cell phones 72 offered help The use of cell phones affects helping behavior
A preliminary examination of cell phone use and helping behavior.
